content: Hi @T-lang/WG-meta, quick meeting?
My biggest news is merging the compiler team contributors discussion
guess not so many folks around this week :)
Oh, whoops, I pinged the wrong alias :)
@T-compiler/WG-meta
dang it
:wave:
I realized something -- does anyone know if we produced any minutes or notes from the meeting about parallel stuff?
I'm not sure.
I was thinking that it would be pretty plausible to have the role of a meta working group over time just be making sure we do this sort of thing
kind of an "organizational group"

I realized something -- does anyone know if we produced any minutes or notes from the meeting about parallel stuff?

I don't think so.
yeah, probably not
I can help on it.
The #t-compiler/wg-parallel-rustc stream has been silent for a while.
Waited for Niko coming back to lead it. :big_smile:
:hi:
@lwshang yeah it's on my list to catch up there...

I was thinking that it would be pretty plausible to have the role of a meta working group over time just be making sure we do this sort of thing

I'm curious what people think of this. I've generally had the feeling like we shouldn't have a dedicated group for this sort of thing, but try to share the load more evenly -- otoh, trying to have a dedicated group of people trying to ensure things are documented and communicated may be a more effective way of actually getting it done. I guess it feels related to documentation etc to me but is potentially distinct -- I could imagine such a group also helping to e.g. run triage meetings and things
Anyway I guess let's do a quick glance over PRs/issues on the compiler-team repo
I don't mind the idea.
Add notes for the triage meeting on 2019-05-23 compiler-team#96 - I think I'll just merg this
Add a repository for cargo-lockfile-sync compiler-team#89
looks like we can merge that
cc @oli -- FCP ended on the above
[WIP] Create static web page for the compiler team with zola compiler-team#83
last update from @Federico Carrone is that this is still WIP, which is fine
[WIP] Add missing directories to experts map compiler-team#95
not a lot of contributions there, maybe I'll mark out some time to jump in
I'm going to open an issue to add minutes from the parallel meeting

not a lot of contributions there, maybe I'll mark out some time to jump in

yeah :(
I've tried to encourage people by opening a thread in t-compiler/help twice but not a lot of engagement unfortunately :(

I don't mind the idea.

Yeah, I kind of like it. It'd be interesting to try and clarify what the scope should be.

Filed https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/issues/98 -- @lwshang did you want to create a minutes file for that meeting? If so, maybe leave a comment in the issue. I don't think it needs to be super detailed. Linking to the zulip topic and taking a note of the major conclusions probably suffices.
I gotta run to another meeting but thanks for your time y'all :)
I'm very glad to take the job. Since I haven't done this before, may I have some thing as a reference?

I'm looking through the "minutes" in the repo, there are some for steering-meeting and triage-meeting. For the minutes I'm going to draft, should I create a separate folder for it? Since the topic was parallel-rustc but it happened on the main stream t-compiler, what name should I have for the folder?
It should go in the working-groups/parallel-rustc/notes.md file (or thereabouts).
I was debating about this =)
either is fine I suppose
we should perhaps keep some kind of log of design meetings and where their minutes wound up though
@nikomatsakis I just sent a PR. Would you like to review and give me some feed back? It's shorter than I expected.
